channel.title: Latest News and News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

item.title: Greece inaugurates first ‘closed’ camp for asylum seekers
item.description: Greece on Saturday inaugurated the first of five new "closed" migrant camps, opposed by rights groups who say the strict access measures are too restrictive.

item.title: US to step up ‘removal flights’ for migrants stranded at Texas bridge
item.description: The United States said Saturday it would step up the number of so-called "removal flights" for thousands of migrants who flooded into the Texas border city of Del Rio, in a bid to alleviate a burgeoning crisis for President Joe Biden's administration.

item.title: Relatives of Afghan family killed in US strike want face-to-face apology
item.description: Relatives of the victims of a US drone strike that wiped out 10 members of an Afghan family in a "tragic mistake" demanded a face-to-face apology and compensation on Saturday.

item.title: Three blasts kill at least two in Afghanistan’s Jalalabad
item.description: Two people were killed when three blasts struck the Afghan city of Jalalabad on Saturday, at least one of which targeted a Taliban vehicle, in the country's first deadly attack since the United States withdrew.

item.title: At least two dead in blasts in Afghanistan’s Jalalabad: Taliban
item.description: At least two people were killed and up to 20 more wounded in three explosions in the eastern Afghan city of Jalalabad on Saturday, a Taliban official said.

item.title: New York Philharmonic marks ‘homecoming’ after pandemic cancellations
item.description: Following 556 days of pandemic-inflicted cancellations and unconventional concerts, the New York Philharmonic opened its new season Friday, a "homecoming" for musicians limited to live streams, one-off and outdoor shows for more than a year.

item.title: Emmy records, LGBTQ firsts and Omar: five things to watch
item.description: The Emmys honoring the best in television return Sunday for the first in-person ceremony since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus case at maternity hospital
item.description: A number of pregnant women will enter isolation after a patient at a Melbourne maternity hospital tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: 10,000 migrants, many Haitian, packed under Texas bridge
item.description: The mayor of Del Rio, Texas declared a state of emergency Friday after more than 10,000 undocumented migrants, many of them Haitians, poured into the border city in a fresh test of President Joe Biden's immigration policy.

item.title: Construction sector told: ‘smarten up’
item.description: The construction industry in Victoria has been warned it could be shut down if strict Covid-19 measures are not followed.
